conclusion: Determine the power of the external force doing work.
Conductor rod OC is rotating in a uniform magnetic field B with angular velocity Ï‰.
Calculate induced emf in rod OC: \( \mathcal{E} = \frac{1}{2} B \omega r^2 \).
Determine current through resistor R using Ohm's law: \( I = \frac{B \omega r^2}{2R} \).
Calculate power dissipated in resistor R: \( P = \frac{B^2 \omega^2 r^4}{4R} \).
Relate power dissipated in resistor to power of external force: they are equal.
Power of the external force doing work is \( \frac{B^2 \omega^2 r^4}{4R} \).
